intro: Loxocarya myrioclada, commonly known as the many-lobed rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with dense, hairy leaves that help it survive in harsh, rocky environments. Its fruit is a dry capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Loxocarya myrioclada is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
